raw_response:
Admeshushah, a traditional Tunisian Jewish Djerban stew originally made with eggs poached in a spicy tomato broth, appears as a rich, hearty stew that is typically served in a bowl. In its plant-based adaptation using tofu, it retains the visual cues of a thick, vibrant tomato-based broth colored by spices and herbs. The stewâ€™s consistency is thicker than a soup but more liquid than a solid dish, resembling a stew with a rich, slightly oily broth that coats the other ingredients.
